result.execSummary:
The defendant John J Eggers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court orders bond on file to be applied. Costs and attorney fees are paid in full.

With Huber and Good Time Credit.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence the defendant is serving.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John J Eggers

records.addlTxt: 12:09 pm case called. Defendant John J Eggers in court with attorney Jeffrey Thomas Haase.  Steven P. Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached and stated on the record. State moves to amend count 1 to Misd Bailjumping in violation of 946.49(1)(a)  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Count 2 DRI. Court sentences the defendant to: 25 days WCJ, consecutive to any other sentence defendant is serving, with Huber and Good Time Credit. Credit for 11 days served. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Court orders bond on file to be applied. Attorney fees of $119.00. Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 12, 2014 at 11:30 am.

Case Called @ 1:43 PM: Defendant John J Eggers in court with attorney Jeffrey Thomas Haase.   Defendant utilized COC's hearing device.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per ADA:  13CF-137 will be resolved today.  14CF-89 will be resolved at a later date.  Resolution on 13CF-137 recited by ADA.  Def and Counsel concur with recital.  Terms of bifurcated SEH explained.    Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Agrees with 3 prior convictions as recited by Court.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea Ct 1 (OWI 4):  NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Ct 2 Dismissed Outright.  Ct 3 DRI.  ADA argues for 30 days TS credit due to inpatient treatment completed.  Argument by Atty Haase as to day-for-day credit - 64 days of treatment completed, verified by VA.  Statement by Def:  Yes, he plans on moving to Kentucky as soon as jail term served.  The Court:  Thanks Def for military service - treatment needs must be addressed with help of VA. Accepts agreement reached.  Imposes 6 mos WCJ - serve forthwith, commence today, 64 days TS credit for inpatient treatment already completed, GT, No Huber Privileges; $1800.00 fine plus DNA surcharge - Bond to be Applied - 60 DTP or PP, bond to be applied to Atty's Fees of $392.75 to be satisfied from bond; 36 mos DL Rev/IID/AODA.  Appeal Rights Given.
Status conference on August 19, 2014 at 10:05 am.
NOH given to DE at the Clerk of Courts window

ADDRESS INFO for John J Eggers
Current: PO box 233, Oakfield, WI 53065 United States  (Effective: 07-03-2014)
Prior: N5428 24th Ave, Wild Rose, WI 54984
by USPS - Not deliverable as addressed - Unable to Forward
Initial appearance on July 16, 2014 at 01:45 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  No operation of any motor vehicles.

Case Called @ 2:10 PM: Defendant John J Eggers in court, in custody, with attorney Jeffrey T Haase, both appearing in person.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  ADA argues as to cash bond.  Atty Haase argues as to Signature Bond.  IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Cash Bond ordered w/conditions.  Initial appearance scheduled for July 16, 2014 at 01:45 pm.
